documentation:
The Annotations model is responsible for managing run-time typed data.

The idea is to allow the meta-models to carry data over to the
formatting process without necessarily knowing about this data, but
yet imposing some constraints on the shape of the data.

elements.name: value
elements.documentation: Base class of all value types.

attributes.name: content
attributes.documentation: Text value.

elements.name: text_collection
elements.documentation: Field can hold a collection of text values.

attributes.name: content
attributes.documentation: Collection of text values.

elements.name: boolean
elements.documentation: Field can hold a Boolean value.

elements.name: name
elements.documentation: Name of the field description or field.

attributes.name: simple
attributes.documentation: Non-qualified name of the field.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation: Qualified name of the field, using dots to separate the hierarchy.

elements.name: value_types
elements.documentation: What values can a field hold.

attributes.name: name
attributes.documentation: Name of the field to which this definition applies.

attributes.name: value_type
attributes.documentation: Type of the field.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.documentation: Valid scopes where the type may be present.

attributes.name: archetype_location
attributes.documentation: The archetype location for this type.

attributes.name: default_value
attributes.documentation: Default value for the field, if any.

elements.name: annotation
elements.documentation: Represents an annotation that can be associated with an external object.

attributes.name: tagged_values
attributes.documentation: All tagged values in this annotation. Each entry is a key-value-pair of id and value.

attributes.name: any
attributes.documentation: Field can appear anywhere.

attributes.name: not_applicable
attributes.documentation: The notion of scopes does not apply to field.

attributes.name: root_module
attributes.documentation: Field can only appear in the root module.

attributes.name: any_module
attributes.documentation: Field can appear in any module.

attributes.name: entity
attributes.documentation: Field can only appear on an entity.

attributes.name: property
attributes.documentation: Field can only appear on a property of an entity.

attributes.name: operation
attributes.documentation: Field can only appear on an operation in an entity.

elements.name: building_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred while the field factory was building.

elements.name: archetype_location
elements.documentation:
Location of an archetype or set of archetypes in the hierarchical artchetype space.

These must be populated in order, e.g. in order to have a backend we must have a
kernel; in order to have a facet we must have a backend and in order to have a
formatter we must have a facet. We may not have any.

attributes.name: kernel
attributes.documentation: Name of the kernel that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: backend
attributes.documentation: Name of the backend that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: facet
attributes.documentation: Name of the facet that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: archetype
attributes.documentation: Name of the archetype that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: all_types
attributes.documentation: All the types available, without categorisation.

attributes.name: types_by_name
attributes.documentation: Types by qualified name.

attributes.name: types_by_facet_name
attributes.documentation: Types by facet names, for all models.

attributes.name: types_by_formatter_name
attributes.documentation: Types by formatter names, for all models.

attributes.name: types_by_backend_name
attributes.documentation: Types by backend name.

attributes.name: partially_matchable_types
attributes.documentation: Types which can be partially matched.

elements.name: selection_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred when attempting to select.

elements.name: hydration_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst trying to hydrate field definitions.

attributes.name: recursive_template
attributes.documentation:
This field applies recursively, from the current level to all below.

The starting point of the recursion is the level supplied by an archetype location.

attributes.name: backend_template
attributes.documentation: This field applies to all backends.

attributes.name: facet_template
attributes.documentation: This field applies to all facets.

attributes.name: archetype_template
attributes.documentation: This field applies to all archetypes.

elements.name: instantiation_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst trying to instantiate a field definition template.

elements.name: type_template
elements.documentation: Defines a template that can be used to instantiate types.

attributes.name: name
attributes.documentation: Name of the field to which this definition applies.

attributes.name: value_type
attributes.documentation: Type of the field.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.documentation: Valid scopes where the type may be present.

attributes.name: archetype_location
attributes.documentation: The archetype location for this type.

attributes.name: default_value
attributes.documentation: Default value for the field, if any.

attributes.name: kind
attributes.documentation: If the type is a template, defines the kind of template.

attributes.name: archetype_locations_by_family
attributes.documentation:
All archetype locations for a given family.

Families are backend specific sets of archetype locations, with associated
properties such as file extensions.

attributes.name: archetype_locations_by_intra_backend_segment
attributes.documentation:
All archetype locations for a given intra-backend segment.

Intra-backend segments are backend specific sets of archetype locations, with
associated properties.

attributes.name: archetype_locations
attributes.documentation: All archetype locations that belong to this group.

attributes.name: canonical_archetype_locations
attributes.documentation:
Maps a concrete archetype location to its canonical form, if the canonical
form is supported. Otherwise no such mapping will exist.

attributes.name: archetype_locations
attributes.documentation:
All archetype locations for the archetypes owned by this transform,
listing all available backends, facets and archetypes.

attributes.name: archetype_locations_by_meta_name
attributes.documentation: Returns the archetype locations for each meta name.

attributes.name: archetype_locations_by_family
attributes.documentation:
All archetype locations for a given family.

Families are backend specific sets of archetype locations, with associated
properties such as file extensions.

attributes.name: archetype_locations_by_intra_backend_segment
attributes.documentation:
All archetype locations for a given intra-backend segment.

Intra-backend segments are backend specific sets of archetype locations, with
associated properties.
